translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter with Chatta
The Story of the Elder Anulepadāyaka
“To the sage Anomadassī,
in the space around the Bodhi tree;
Having given a lump of rice porridge,
I did a service with my hands.
Seeing that well-done deed,
the supreme man Anomadassī;

analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghe ṭhitaḥ satthā  imam gātham abhāsatha
translated: The Teacher, standing in the Community of monks,🔽recited this verse:
‘By this deed of rice porridge,
and by the intention and aspiration;
Having experienced perfection,
he will make an end to suffering.’
My face is serene,
I am one-pointed and well-concentrated;
I bear this last body,
in the Dispensation of the Buddha.
For a hundred thousand aeons in the past,
complete and not less,
I was a king named Sabbaghana,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Anulepadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā anulepadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Anulepadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai anulepadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽anulepadāyaka therassa apadānam chaṭṭha
translated: The Story of the Elder Anulepadāyaka is the sixth.
